channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The agriculture secretary says SNAP changes are coming. Here's what we know
item.description: Brooke Rollins has made a case for sweeping changes to food aid programs by claiming USDA has uncovered "massive fraud." But she and USDA haven't prov...

item.title: Austria's rebel nuns refuse to give up Instagram to stay in their convent
item.description: The trio of octogenarian nuns gained global fame after fleeing their care home and breaking into their former convent. Now their superior has asked th...

item.title: Pope Leo visits a wounded Lebanon in his first trip to the Middle East
item.description: Pope Leo XIV is on his first visit to Lebanon. He arrives at a pivotal time for the country, buffeted by conflict with Israel and a devastating econom...

item.title: U.S. tightens immigration after National Guard shooting. And, latest on Ukraine talks
item.description: The White House is moving swiftly to tighten legal immigration reviews after two National Guard members were shot last week. And, Ukraine enters a new...

item.title: Oregon Sen. Ron Wyden on extending the Affordable Care Act subsidies
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Sen. Ron Wyden, D-Ore., about the debate in Congress to extend the Affordable Care Act subsidies, which are set to expir...

item.title: Rubio says "more work to be done" after hours of U.S.-Ukraine talks
item.description: Diplomats have been focused on revisions to a proposed plan developed in negotiations between Washington and Moscow.

item.title: Investigators urge witnesses of the deadly shooting at a child’s party in California to come forward
item.description: Authorities are urging witnesses of a deadly shooting at a child’s birthday party in Stockton, California, to come forward as they continue to search ...

item.title: UK MP Tulip Siddiq given jail sentence in Bangladesh after trial in her absence
item.description: The former minister and niece of Bangladesh's ousted former leader, who received a two-year sentence, says the charges are politically motivated.

item.title: Trump endorses Republican in Tennessee special election
item.description: A special election is underway for Tennessee's 7th Congressional District. Political strategists Kristian Ramos and Leslie Sanchez join CBS News with ...

item.title: Four dead in Russian attack as diplomatic efforts to end war continue
item.description: As US negotiating teams continue to hold talks with Moscow and Kyiv, Russia's attacks on Ukraine continue.

item.title: Jared Kushner joining Steve Witkoff on Russia trip for Putin meeting, source confirms
item.description: Jared Kushner will accompany Trump administration envoy Steve Witkoff on his trip to Moscow to meet with Russian President Vladimir Putin over the war...

item.title: 11/30/2025: Polymarket; CRISPR Kids; Lamine Yamal
item.description: First, Polymarket lets you bet on almost anything. Then, a look at teens' innovative Lyme disease research. And, Lamine Yamal: The 60 Minutes Intervie...

item.title: Shock in Cameroon as 74-year-old opposition firebrand dies in detention
item.description: Anicet Ekane's lawyer says the family was given little explanation - "his wife was just presented the corpse".

item.title: Appeals court disqualifies Alina Habba as acting U.S. attorney in New Jersey
item.description: A federal appeals court on Monday upheld a lower court decision that disqualified Alina Habba as acting U.S. attorney in New Jersey.

item.title: Death toll in Indonesia floods passes 500 with hundreds more missing
item.description: Another 500 people are missing, while thousands more have been injured after a cyclone hit the region.

item.title: Three children among four killed in shooting at 'birthday party' in California
item.description: Officials say 11 others are injured in what they believe is a "targeted" shooting at a children's birthday party.

item.title: Trump invites families of 2 National Guard members who were shot to visit the White House
Suspect in National Guard attack struggled with ‘dark isolation’ as community raised concerns
